footer-left:
This site is actively using JavaScript.
It doesn't contain ads, but is blocked by some ad filters.
Please turn it off to continue and reload the page.

keyboard_limitation_note: Please note that when you are working with a KVM session or another application that captures the keyboard,you can't use some keyboard shortcuts such as Ctrl+Alt+Del (which will be caught by your OS) or Ctrl+W (caught by your browser).
browser_solution_note: To override this limitation you can use Google Chrome in application mode.
index_title: The Open Source KVM over IP
vnc_daemon_running: This One-KVM device has running kvmd-vnc daemon and provides VNC access to the server.
vnc_security_warning: WARNING! We strongly don't recommend you to use VNC in untrusted networks without enabled X.509 or TLS encryption. Otherwise your passwords are transmitted in a plain text over the network.
vnc_client_requirements: Your VNC client must support Tight JPEG compression and password authentication. TigerVNC is a good choice.On Linux, this client will most likely be available for installation from the repository. It can also be called vncviewer.
ipmi_daemon_running: This One-KVM device has running kvmd-ipmi daemon and provides IPMI 2.0 interface for some basic BMC operations like on/off/reset the server.
ipmi_security_warning: WARNING! We strongly don't recommend you to use IPMI in untrusted networks because this protocol is completely unsafe by design. In short, the authentication process for IPMI mandates that the server send a salted SHA1 or MD5 hash of the requested user's password to the client, prior to the client authenticating.
ipmi_password_recommendation: NEVER use the same passwords for KVMD and IPMI users. And even better not to use IPMI. Instead, you can directly use KVMD API via curl. Here some examples:

macro_security_note: For security reasons, the record will not be saved on the PiKVM
text_keyboard_layout_note: Please note that One-KVM cannot switch the keyboard layout
text_ocr_enter_hint: Press Enter to recognize and copy text to clipboard
drive_note_browser: • Don't close the browser page until the upload is complete.
drive_note_stream: • To speed up the upload, close the stream window.
video_record_description: Record video using the browser API, and will be downloaded automatically
drive_transfer_upload_note: • Select NormalFiles tab to upload, package them and mount image
drive_transfer_download_note: • Disconnect MSD, unpackage it, select tab to download
hid-keyboard-swap-cc-switch: Swap Left Ctrl and Caps keys
stream-message-no-webrtc: WebRTC is not supported by this browser
stream-message-no-h264: H.264 is not supported by this browser
msd-message-too-big-for-cdrom: Current image is too big for CD-ROM!
msd-message-out-of-storage: Current image is out of storage
msd-message-downloads: The image is being downloaded from One-KVM
page-full-tab-stream-switch: Expand for the entire tab by default
usb_breaker_confirm: Turning off this switch will disconnect the main USB from the server. Are you sure you want to continue?
stream-suspend-switch: Suspend stream when tab is not active:
